message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR, cs.MM 

This paper deals with the problem of 3D object recognition using both textural and shape features. Therefore, it is likely to belong to the computer vision (cs.CV) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a method for learning the relative weighting of the two modalities in a data-specific manner, which suggests that it may also belong to the machine learning (cs.LG) sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of synthetic data for optimization, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The problem of 3D object recognition involves geometric representations of objects, which suggests that it may also belong to the graphics (cs.GR) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the representation of objects using histograms, which is a common technique in multimedia (cs.MM).
